intro: Dicliptera leonotis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic to many animals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a rough texture, and it produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
